intro: Sesamella, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers and thick, velvety leaves. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Sesamella is popular in horticulture for its ability to bloom throughout the year under proper care.
